review_content: Lang genoeg bij Apple's Genius Bar gezeten om nu een klein biertje verdiend te hebben. Geen topper, gewoon ok. Wel een badge scoren ;-)

Old rating from 16-06-15 - 355ml bottle brought back from the States by a friend, poured at home in Jersey. It's amber with a white foamy head. Aromas & tastes of caramel, toffee, bread, grass & malt. Medium body. Moderate bitter finish. Very enjoyable

Pours an amber colour ale with a white frothy head 
Notes of roasted toffee caramel and malt 
Cask
Bottle from Waitrose multi-pack. Amber colour, with small head. Subtle malte & straw aromas with pleasant, even bitter finish.

12oz bottle from Beers of Europe, and drunk on 18/08/2006.  This was pre-takeover.  Honestly, getting any American beers was great and I really liked how this was sort of similar to English bitters, but with more distinct hop profile, and generally just bigger flavour.  A hint of things to come.

35,5cl Bottle @ Saveur-Biere, Fretin, France.
Hazy amber colour with a thin white head.
Aroma is malt, straw, citrus.
Taste is malt, sweet, bread, citrus, slightly yeasty.
Medium body, average carbonation.

Nice clear deep-golden pour with near-white head; reasonable retention. Aroma is weak (although I have a cold at the moment), malty and soft hoppy. Taste is mild bitter, lasting long. Strong carbonation, bit watery feel. Not very interesting mix between English and American ale.

09.12.2019 - 0.3l bottle from auchan in strasbourg. pours a slightly hazy pale amber with a medium dense head and a nice lacing. aroma of wood, honey, dry caramel, slight mango. flavour of wood, citrus, quite mild but easy drinkable.
Flaska. Disig orange med ett smutsvitt skum. Dofter av frukt, örter och malt. Smakinslag av apelsinkärnor, malt, frukt, säd och tall. Medelbeska. En högst ordinär bitter.

Bottle at Checkpoint Charlie 2019-10-25
AR: dried tropical fruity, bitter orange
AP: hazy orange/amber, wee off white head
F: : dried tropical fruity, bitter orange
Thuis uit een flesje. Amberkleur, roomwit schuim. Vlak aroma, wel een lekkere bitterheid in de smaak. Redelijk bier, goed doordrinkbaar.

Botella de 355 ml @ Saveur Biere online store. Color ámbar con un dedo de espuma cremosa. Retención media en vaso. 
Aromas a cereal, caramelo, pan, piel de naranja. En boca es ligeramente amarga, más bien dulce. Mucho cereal tostado, cítricos. Correcta.

En copa, cerveza ámbar ligeramente túrbia y con una generosa capa de espuma blanco hueso. Aroma a cereales blancos, caramelo, especias, regaliz, cítricos como naranja, algo de pan y levadura. En boca, textura ligera y acuosa, de carbonatación media y amargor suave. Sabor dulce a cereales caramelizados, junto con naranja, fruta madura, regaliz, pan y un ligero sabor metálico final. Una cerveza correcta, sin nada a destacar.

En bouteille 344 ml. Robe ambrée, carbonatation faible. Une bière de caractère malgré sa faible teneur en alcool. Arômes légèrement caramélisés et fruités: pêche, mangue... amertume présente et agréable. Trouvée à Intermarché Dives (14)
Rood/bruin achtig kleurend bier met een milde witte schuimkraag. Het bier is ietwat licht van smaak en heeft naast een granige smaak niet veel aroma.
A great Ale smooth and refreshing with a color that will make you never forget this beer.

Aromat: bardzo bogaty słodowy aromat, delikatny karmel, delikatnie ciasteczkowy, biszkoptowy, na koniec klasycznie chmielowy dość intensywnie. Aromat poprawny ale jak na bittera mógłby być ciut bardziej intensywny szczególnie ta część słodowa. Wygląd: tutaj jest super, pomarańcz, jasny brąz, całkiem konkretnie mętne, piękna kremowa piana, trwała drobna i niesamowicie zdobi szkło. Na tym polu 5/5. W smaku delikatnie słodkie, później lekki nugat, biszkopt, ciastka korzenne. Na koniec dość dobrze zaznaczona chmielowa goryczka. Bardzo czysty profil, żadnych niepożądanych nut. Podniebienie: średnio-niskie ciało, dość nisko nasycony, mega łatwo się piję, fajnie zaznaczona chmielowa goryczka na końcu. Podsumowując: bardzo przyjemny bitterek, poprawnie wykonany, nie ma niepożądanych smaków ani aromatów. Dla mnie ciut mało intensywny mimo wszystko nawet jak na bittera ale poprawny i bardzo dobrze się piję. Jeśli ktoś szuka prostego łatwego i lekkiego piwa do grilla to jak najbardziej polecam. 3.6/5.0.
Bottle from Asda. Clear copper appearance. Aroma is malts and spiced. Flavour is bitter, dry, malt, wood, roasted, orange and citrus.

Même si elle profite d'un équilibre très correct, cet Honkers Ale vient remplir le stock des bières sans grand intérêt. Compliqué de se passionner. En verre, nous sommes sur un ambré légèrement voilé sans mousse. Le nez est sur le mile, l'orange avec une pointe de fruits rouges et d'épices. L'attaque est peu aromatique avec un caramel qui prédomine, légèrement poivré et avec une touche d'orange. Elle présente également une très légère acidité. La deuxième bouche s'enrichit et se complexifie quelque peu avec des arômes de biscuit, de caramel, de petites notes de fruits rouges et notamment de cassis et une petite pointe herbacée. L’arrière est sur une amertume simple, légèrement herbacée mais peu intéressante (IBU de 30). Le final, court est sur une fraîcheur houblonnée également. L'alcool à 4,3 % est trop limité. Heureusement la présence en bouche est acceptable.  Pas mémorable.
God og velsmagende bitter. Tilpas med sødme og bitterhed. God, indbydende aroma.

Colore ambrato, schiuma fine e poco persistente.
Al naso e al palato preponderante il malto.
Carbonazione media.

Belle robe ambrée, trouble (à froid). Mousse blanche moyennement persistante (fine pellicule résiduelle). Arômes caramel, croûte de pain, agrumes, thé vert. Première attaque caramel, biscuit, fumé réglisse. Agrumes, résineux en seconde bouche. Texture légèrement aqueuse (mais bon, 4.3%...). Carbonatation fine, moyennement abondante.
Pas extraordinaire mais facile à boire.

Cerveza con aroma frutal y con buen nivel de carbonatada. Sabor suave y equilibrado, con un intenso color rubí.
Acompañado con salmón ahumado

First sample from Goose Island.  All 3 singles I bought say brewed and bottled in NY though, so I guess they have a brewery on the east coast as well?  4.2% ABV.....definitely something lighter for early day/night or dinner pairing.  On the thinner side, about average for this style.  Nice flavor and semi-smooth feel.  Decent beer that I could drink a lot of, but not sure I'd really want a full 6 of this.

12oz Flasche. Dunkel oranges klares Bier, heller Schaum. Karamell, Süssholz Aromen. Kräftige Bitternoten. Karamell und ein Hauch Lakritz. Lange bitter. Klassischer Inselstoff, gebraut in der neuen Welt.

Bottle at Travelodge Winnersh, golden/amber with small white head, lightly cloudy. Aroma is citrus, american hops + roasted malts. Light bitter taste, long finish, medium body, average carbonation. Quite boring.
Some hop and malt aroma. Medium off-white head, lightly hazy amber color. A bit sour, a few bitterness at the end. Light to medium body, dry.
Birra bitter ale ambrata con schiuma fine poco persistente. Al naso, come in bocca, sapori fruttati.

Color naranja oscuro, translúcida. Espuma marfil de dos dedos de espesor y muy buena retención. Aroma a maltas tostadas, caramelo. Sabor igual, más un punto especiado, ligeramente aguada, aún así es muy rica y bebible. Textura sedosa. Carbonatación media.

355ml bottle at Travelodge London City. Pours dark golden with a thin dissipating head. Light caramel malts on the nose with some floral and spicy elements. Not much of an aroma probably because it was too cold. Thin, watery body. Taste is pretty decent actually - bready, caramel malt backbone nicely balanced with a pleasant hoppy bitterness. Some floral and earthy notes as well. A pretty decent American take on an English bitter.
Amarga y espesa, con aroma a lúpulo. Demasiado oscura para una lager y con escasa espuma. Deja un regusto algo afrutado.
Muy buena cerveza, sabor agradable en el paladar, lo único malo de esta cerveza aquí en Chile el costo es muy elevado.

Pours clear amber with a white head. Aroma of dry spices. Taste is watery malt with slightly bitter notes on the back of the mouth. Palate includes grass and more unroasted malt. Drinkable, not remarkable.
Mediocre beer. Refreshing because of the hops, a subtle caramel touch so very drinkable

Very decent one, hoppy fruity but not overly bitter. Pours orange copper, with a quite well balanced malty backbone (light caramel) and nice hoppy perfume

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Picked this up in a bottle at the local supermarket here in Sapporo, Japan. It was a dear $4.25 and I know for sure there are better local, cost performers, but I wanted to try this one again. Poured a great golden orange with a nice creamy head. Nice caramel nose with the promised fruity hoppy aroma. The image of a pale ale as I imagine it. Tastes of breads and the caramel malt keeps it drinkable against this well hopped ale. Goes well with foods, not overly hopped. I like it, If I’d brewed it, I’d certainly brag...  but the price tag is an unavoidable barrier for Japan. No repurchase here.

Bouteille de 355ml. Couleur dorée, mousse moyenne, peu de tenue. Ça commence pas trop mal avec une agréable attaque un peu acidulée, puis une "vague" fruitée qui s' estompe très très vite puis la bière devient aqueuse en fin de bouche. Trouvée à Intermarché.

473ml can from LCBO
Dark orange, light head
Very weak and watery feel, no substance 
Tries to be an English bitter or ale, but it lacks quality

Pint on tap at Fratelli Fresh, Darling Harbour Sydney. Looks the goods, apart from the too high carbonation. Foamy head, golden amber beer. Excellent nose of weet bix, biscuits, and caramel. Thin body with a mild sour taste. Finish is metallic and lasting. Mouthfeel is harsh and prickly. A real curate's egg. Looks like a bitter, smells like a great bitter, but drinks like a cheap lager. Like a beer designed by a computer.
Pours clear chestnut with a full, beige head. Aroma is dried fruit and light roast. Taste is light raisin, moving to roast and a building hop backbone. Finish is roast. A decent bitter.

A single tall can from Viti Liquor in east Vancouver. An orange amber beer with modest off white head and a malted nose. Sweet, mellow malt flavors with a trace of hop bitterness. Not really my style of beer, but enjoyable anyhow, and very decent for the Bitter style. I rate it somewhat more flavorful than Fuller’s ESB. 3.8
Wenig Frucht, dafür deutlicher Malzkörper, hinten bitter, sehr angenehm zu trinken.
Earthy hop aroma.  Flavor is great balance of hops, floral, and sweet caramel malt and a little spice or earthy taste.
Ale muito aromática e saborosa, cor caramelo, não é muito forte, que possibilita tomar varias xD

Robe ambrée limpide, mousse faible aux reflets roux. Nez toasté, caramélisé et biscuité, légèrement sucré. En bouche, c'est équilibré, biscuité, entre le grillé et le corps caramélisé. Agréable, facile à boire tout en étant aromatique. Sympa.
Cor âmbar quase translúcida.  Aroma levemente maltado. Espuma de baixa formação. Levemente carbonatada, ao menos o meu lote. Leve amargor no final e só.

2014 rating. Enjoyed on tap at D'Arcy McGee's just before seeing Al Pacino at the NAC in Ottawa. Pours a thin foamy cap and has an amber appearance. Decent sticky lacing. Aromas of malts, nuts, a bit of barley and earthy hops. Flavours are quite fruity, a bit of resin and mild citrus hops. Very light notes of caramel. Fruity taste is mainly citrus and some plums as well. Tingling sensation. Medium bodied mouthfeel.
Achetée à Carrefour. Bière ambrée au nez houblonné et résineux. Bouche malté et sèche

Botella @Carrefour, Toulouse 28/06/2018
 Color ambarino corona de espuma blanca escasa, aromas caramelo, sabor maltosa, caramelo, cuerpo medio.
Bouteille de 341 ml. Couleur blonde avec un joli col blanc. Arômes de céréales et de fruits acides. Le goût est à peu près pareil aux arômes. Bière assez générique et très rafraîchissante.
Ocena na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji na potrzeby uzupełnienia profilu.

Regular Regular Regular Regular Regular Regular Regular Regular Regular Regular 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Malty brown appearance with almost no carbonation and very thin white head. Light aromas of sweet tree fruits with some hops. Even with 30IBU, it is difficult to find the bitterness, mainly due to the lack of a notable finish or aftertaste. Each sip is filled with bread-y flavor, a bit watery though and easy to drink. It won't start a revolution, but is decent.
Légers arômes de pêches et caramel. Belle robe ambrée. Attaque sur du fruit et du boisé. Langueur sur du caramel. Bien bonne.

Honey coloured. Medium density with low formation foam. Lightly malted, toasted and sweet aroma. On mouth, lightly malted and toasted and a really low bitterness at the of the sip. The aftertaste is a little bit more bitter and malted.
A refreshing beer with high drinkability.

Honey coloured. Medium density with low formation foam. Lightly malted, toasted and sweet aroma. On mouth, lightly malted and toasted and a really low bitterness at the of the sip. The aftertaste is a little bit more bitter and malted.
A refreshing beer with high drinkability.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I'm a bit ashamed that I haven't rated this one yet. Pours a clear amber with a medium white head. The aroma is a balance of toasted malt, caramel, bread, and floral hops. Its lighter and isn't offensive. The taste offers mild bitterness. As in the nose, impressions are a little more tame. It contains caramel, nuts, bread, toasted malt, apple, and floral hints and spices. Easy caramel finish. Light in body and kind of thin in texture. I feel this is easy enough drinking even though nothing in particular jumps out and grabs my attention. Perfect for when I'm sick of IPAs and I'm looking for something light.
Pours a brown colour. Tasye is bitter with a slight hop background. Bit thin and watery on the palate
Lots of malts slight metallic tinge. This is a pretty average bitter tbf. Overcarbonated and lacking complexity. Average example of the style. Nice sweet toffee malts.
Bottle. Pours amber, diminishing lace. Aroma woody hop. Taste is medium sweet to bitter. Palate is medium bodied, oily texture but too much fizz. A bitter and an average one.
Light caramel malts, but needs more hops and bitterness, a bit sweet for me. Not great.
Tasted like a nice pale ale. Hoppy but not grapefruity or not overly so. 30 IBU. 4.3 ABV ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Citrus hop beginning to a weak bitter finish. A nice bouquet but flavours are disjointed.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Found in bottle at Binnys in Aurora, Illinois. Enjoyable malt forward but the mix wasn't well balanced .Just so-so but drinkable.
33cl from bottle bought at Waitrose. Malty, light and fruity. Really light body
(miel, nez > fruit (fraise, rasp, cassis), bouche légère maltée, bitter (de soif), fraise, ~cara, fade, 0-finale-last)
Birra ambrata e dalla schiuma compatta e abbastanza persistente. Buon aroma fruttato e gusto tendente al dolce di malto e agrumi. Poco corpo, ma normale essendo una bitter.

Cuivrée très claire avec assez peu de nez. Le coté amer de la bière ne se perçoit pas beaucoup aux premiers abords, elle pourrait même manquer de caractère mais en reste néanmoins facile et agréable à boire.
overall a very enjoyable malt forward ale. a little fruity a little spicy. pleasant
0,473l can. Pours slightly hazy copper. Caramel malt mostly, with bitter finish. Quite average.
Amber color, small white head. Overall malts in the aroma. Taste like traditional English bitter. Nothing special

Pours a slightly hazy amber colour with average carbonation. Aromas are of lightly toasted malts, berry fruits and a gentle hop presence which is slightly earthy, grassy and fruity. Taste is well balanced and drinkable, a nice malt centre with gentle hop bitterness over the top, slightly skewed towards the hop bitterness at the finish. Delivers classic English bitter taste profile, very drinkable. Good but unspectacular.
Bottle. Amber, mostly clear. Malt and mild fruit flavour. Bitter hop aftertaste.

Very drinkable
I modsætning af andre bitter, er denne med en moden Hop aroma 
Fin lille midte af malt, til at mildne hop 
Flot gylden farve
Mild body 
slick feel, average carbonation,
Bottle 355 ml from Morrisons, Acton. Aromas are malts, sweet honey and subtle oats. Clear amber bubbly body and small white head. Taste is bitter with malts, honey, aramel, fruitiness/plum notes.

Keg at Rewind Bar, Leek. A clear amber colour with a medium white head. Aroma of toasted malts, some bready malts, subtle fruit and slight spicy hops. Taste of toasted malts, some grain, slight fruit, a hint of sourness and subtle spicy hops. Light bodied and moderate carbonation. A short, dry, spicy malt bitterness in the finish. The most standard of American bitters/red ale. Drinkable but not the best.
Birra ale, schiuma poco persistente , colore rossastro corpo pieno con sentore di frutti ed agrumi sul finale. Dalle aspettative desideravo qualcosa in più... Senza infamia e senza lode
Une de nos Goose Island préférées, beaucoup de caractère, gourmande et amère, rafraîchissante et peu alcoolisée.
Rating from memory so that I've got my facts and figures right. Not much in the way of tasting notes, but more on the malty end of what I prefer. Not a bad brew!

21/XI/17 - sample @ Horeca Expo (Ghent) - BB: n/a (2017-1927) Thanks to the brewers for today's samples and my Ghent beer posse for sharing the glasses and keeping my liver sane. :p


Clear orange beer, creamy off)white head, pretty stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: spicy, smelly, bit weird, unpleasant. MF: soft carbon, medium to light body. Taste: very malty, grains, very watery. Aftertaste: little bitter, watery, malty, grains, cow fodder. Man, am I glad I didn't have to pay for this one.

A clear amber beer with a small white head and a lot of gas. Aroma is not very strong, but there is some malt, caramel and yeast. Faint taste with some bitterness at the end. Light bodied with some carbonation and faint astringency. After taste is very mild. Very easy to drink but only because it is very watery.

21-01-2018; bottle; drank in Voss, Norway (bought at Saveur Bière, as part of their Januari 2018 discovery box). 
The looks of the beer are nice. The beer has a chestnut color, with a nice coppery glow. The beer has a nice haziness. On top of the beer some rough off-white foam is formed. Foam retention is average. Hardly a drape is left after some time. Not the most special looking beer, but it is nice.
The smell of the beer quite nice. There aren't a lot of malt aroma's. Maybe just a sweet note. There are quite some nice hop aromas though. They are very fruity. I smell some orange, zest, more citrus fruits and some nice hints of fresh apple. The hops have a nice sour fresh fruity nose. I like it.
The taste has more malts. There is a nice full malty flavour, giving a soft sweetness. Hops are also present, but are slightly less fruity and zesty, but have more of a piney touch. Still nice though. It is well balanced. Not the most special beer, but it is a nice easy drinkable one.
The palate of the beer is fine. Light body, thin texture and medium carbonation. The finish of the beer has some citrus hop notes and a dry bitter finish. All in all, a nice beer, but not worlds most special beer.

bottle. light brown hazey. med carb. light bodied.  tobacco, toasted finish with bready malt. lingering bitter finish with sour notes. looks like the real deal. tastes like the real deal...just isn't.

On draught at Old Chicago April 11, 2015.

Pours a clear copper/gold, good head of foam to start, recedes leaving little lacing behind.

Smells of bready malt, some sweetness, touch of h

Light bodied, kinda lively carbonation.

Average beer, imho.
Tastes of bread, malty sweetness, light bitterness, very lightly flavoured overall.
citrus, herbs, golden, orange, brown, minimal head, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness,

Hazy auburn color with a creamy head of offwhite foam. Aromas and flavors of rich bready and caramel malt with a light blueberry and orange citrus in the background. Herbaceous and slightly bitter hops linger on the palate.

355ml bottle from NYC Grill, Darlington. Amber brown colour, tan foam head leaving lacing and bready malt aroma. Taste is malty, doughy, toffee, alittle spicy, with fruity, earthy bitterness. Light to medium bodied, medium carbonation, dry bitter finish. Quite OK.
Pours golden with a decent head (within a nucleated oval pint glass). Medium bitterness. Nice on the pallet. Fruity and malty. I enjoyed this beer and would buy again.
at home amber colored body with a white head and with a spicy fruity hop aroma a spicy herby light fruity hops dry taste with a slight bitter finish
Klares Bernstein mit relativ wenig Schaum. Malzig, reichlich Karamell, etwas würzig, leicht herb.
Butelka, kolor bursztynowy, piany prawie brak. Aromat słodkawego słodu w smaku lekko kwaśne, wodniste, słabe.
Aroma intenso, frutado e muito agradável. Sabor com amargor balanceado. Cor âmbar e espuma bege.
back log rating so no notes on aroma , palate etc . Just the rating from an old app
No head. Weak body. Smell and taste a bit extract home brewy. Not terrible but wouldn't buy again
Amber, bubbly with medium fastly dissapearing beige head. Slightly sweet malty aroma. Medium to strong bitterness on the malty background, some sourness, carbonated and bit watery.
A great ale that's full of citrus and hoppy aromas and flavors with a not too strong bitterness or alcohol content.
À peine bitter, très fluide, sans originalité mais pas mauvaise pour autant

Bottle from de Caigny in Essen, Belgium. 
The beer is amber colored and has a small and unstable creamy head, with good carbonation. 
The aroma is very malty with a lot of caramel, wheat, yeast and in the background small notes of fruits and fresh hops. 
The taste is light to medium bodied with a caramel sweet and a rich malt body. Further there are some notes of fresh hops and fruits.
The finish is light dry, bitter and watery. 
Well drinkable beer, but nothing special.
Elle a une belle couleur, elle est bien légère. C'est plutôt une bière de soif sans grande particularité, mais assez agréable.
Cuivrée quasi limpide, peu effervescente, malt doux, léger caramel, notes boisées et fruitées. Bouteille 33cl achetée en grande surface, Paris, France, bue le 11/08/2017.
Bottle - clear syrup orange colour with little carbonation and next to no head. Orangey aroma. Ting on tongue and in mouth. Fruity tasting with bitter finish.
Il. Colore è ambra rossastro, schiuma poco persistente ma fine. Aroma maltato, al palato è semplice da vera bitter. Malto dolcezza generale e fruttata. Carbonazione media. Molto ben fatta.

Possui aroma de lúpulo frutado com um rico meio malte para tornar uma cerveja bem equilibrada.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Lichtbruin bier met weinig schuim. Smaak is vrij vlak en licht bitter met iets van karamel en ietwat graan. Geen echt bijzonder bier maar ook niet echt slecht. Middelmatig.
Classic deep bronze bitter colour, thin head due to my glass. lovely sweet malt aroma taste to follow toffee malty nutty fruit. Nice sweetness. Bitter balance perfect . V tasty for a easy drinker.

First rating in ages. Great copper orange pour, with thin white lacing. Sweet and malty aroma, with a hint of hops. Sweet bread and malty taste, slightly bitter aftertaste. Highly carbonated and medium bodied. Not bad, not great. Great for sessions i'm sure!!!

355ml bottle. Pours a clear orange gold and a thin white head. Aroma: mild citrus, caramel and fruitbowl aroma. Taste: mild citrus and peach flavours. Very mild pine and biscuity mslt flavours. Very weak flavoured. Not much going on. Thin bodied. Moderate to high carbonation. Moderate bitterness thst dominates the backend of the palate. This beer is a tad bit boring. It is not bad, just boring.
From bottle. Transfer of an earlier rating without text recorded, rating only.
Bottle from Beer Hawk. Clear copper with an aggressive head. Low on aroma. Taste is malty, grassy hops with mild bitterness and a hint of plum.

Pours brown with a quickly fading head and no real lacing.

Aroma is caramel malts, pine, toffee and marmelade. Taste is sweet with a medium bitter and thin finish.

Nice malty flavour, but too thin.

An English style bitter with a 30 IBU. Had on tap at roosters restaurant. A solid, very drinkable beer. Hoppy, but not overly so because it is so well balanced. Light caramel and citrus notes. A definite dry, sour/bitter aftertaste, that lingers, but is not unpleasant.

Early September 2015 had it from a bottle I enjoyed it more the first time but still think it is a good beer 

Mid November 2015. You can taste the bitter but it is not a hop bitter more of a sour taste. A decent beer but I wouldn't buy it for home drinking again


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Helder oranjekleurig bier met crèmekleurige schuimkraag. Geur: mout, karamel, licht fruitig, vleugje sinaasappel. Smaak: mout, licht zoet. Redelijk volmondig voor 4,3%. Medium koolzuurprikkel. Makkelijk drinkbaar, maar wat saai.
Clear light amber color with aroma of caramel and bread. Caramel and fruit sweetness with some biscuit.
bouteille 33 cl- couleur ambrée, odeur de céréal, de pain, caramel, goût sur le pain, le caramel, légèrement sucrée, mousse blanche
Bottle from supermarket. Mild bittterness, sweet, lagery, not something english ale like to me
Orangenes Bier schöner schaum im Geruch Brot Honig malz leichte Frucht, im Geschmack malzig dann herb leichte trockenfrüchte eine Spur holzig fassig, ganz ok aber nicht umwerfend
Oranje/bruin met lichte kraag. Aroma van mout, caramel, zoet, weeig. Smaken zijn erg dun, waterig, slap, veel caramel, mout, weeig, slappe body, niet bijzonder
cereal, floral, amber, clear, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, light body, flat, bitter,

This is a re-rate.  It pours amber with an off-white head.  The aroma is fruit, caramel, and bread.  The taste is caramel, fruit, and bread. This is smooth and very drinkable.  This is a good session beer.

Bread and malt smells with some sour apple.Pours a cloudy orange with an anemic white qyuickly dissipating head. Plenty of lacing. Oily bitter flavors of leather and a little caramel malty notes. Good imitation of the style

Bottle pour into shaker pint glass from One Stop Market. Appearance is clear amber with nice sparkle, 1/2-finger width white head with poor retention and no lacing. Aroma is bread, fruit, earth. Taste is caramel and bread, hint of fruit. Palate is light-to-medium bodied with watery texture, lively carbonation and crisp malt with light bitter finish. Overall, aroma and taste are not bold but there is some hop/malt balance here.
Bottle, UK import, source not recorded. Backlog entry. Entering my historic scores for US beers whilst visiting New York. No tasting notes kept, just rating.

Dégustée au printemps 2016 (De mes notes).                                                                                                                                                                          .
Fles gekocht en geprobeerd in Luxemburg, het is een oranje rood achtig bier met een medium schuimkraag. Het heeft een vreemde geur, de smaak is licht zoet en hoppig.
33 cl bottle from outback steak house the place shanghai. pours hazy amber with big head. malty light hoppy aroma with slight malty hoppy notes.
Bottle. Somewhat pale amber with a medium white head. Light to medium body with moderate carbonation. SUbtle bitter and sweet tones. Caramel, malts, some hops and fruits. Refreshing.

Copper color with a sticky white head. Malty, sweet, hoppy nose. Unfortunately the flavor doesnt’t resemble the nose. Sweet, not much malt, a weak bitter finish. Body is quite watery. Lacks flavor... .

Only Known American made bitter in area. Best beer in England is a Pint of Bitter.
Although did have Cask bitter at Gritty’s McGruf in Portland a few years back and thought I was back in England for a minute. Until I got my Lobster roll that is.
Nothing too fancy here. A bit of malt and hops on the nose. Taste is the same with some caramel, thin bodied.
Bottle. Amber color with a white head. Light fruit, floral and biscuit aroma. The taste is a little sweet. Nice ale.
Bottle from Carre four, Brugge. Amber with xl head. Malty, some fruity, medium bitterness.
Got this one from LCBO Winter pack in a can. Took this one while watching American Sniper. Light beer, wasn’t sure what what kind of beer this is. Ok beer, not great, not bad.

From my local Carr* market  >> Bitter à l’anglaise: ambrée peu maltée et moyennement amère au goût trop prononcé de caramel avec une faible carbonation. La bouche est rêche, l’arrière goût est métallique accompagné d’une saveur maltée légère au goût vague de noisette de pain grillé. Le milieu bouche est une peu épais, gras au palais. Les saveurs fruitées des houblons sont fuyantes. La finale sèche et assoifante, comme si on avait rajouté de la farine de maïs. Plutôt oubliable.
Clear copper colour. Not a tonne of head. Aroma is biscuit. Taste is some gingerbread, malt, and caramel. Light bitterness. Nothing special.

Bottle from The Pancake House, Elveden Forest Centre Parc. Fruity floral aroma. FLight chestnut. Thin white head. Light bitter. Malty. Caramel sweetness comes through into the finish. Relatively light bodied and thin. Fizzy carbonation. Dry finish. OK. A UK style bitter with US influences.

355ml bottle. Pours light chestnut amber with a small off white head. Nose is very malty, brown bread, toast and biscuit. Light soft carbonation, taste is very bready and biscuity. A slight toasted, nutty taste too, before leading into a light to medium bitter orange peel, apricot and grapefruit dry finish. It’s good if you’re comparing it to traditional English bitters( which are pretty bland ) but OK if not. Unremarkable beer, but nice enough to enjoy one or two before moving on to something better !

I bought this bottle at bootleger in Paris. I drink it today at Bonfol, before to go the swimming pool. Unfortunately, I didn’t know the version before In-bev. The limit to drink it is at November 2017. In my point of view, it is a correct ale, not bad, if I compare some comments, I coud say that you really have worst beers and breweries, even the fact thar this one sold this soul to the God of the wild capitalism, but it is just my personal view, I repeat!!!!! We could say that it is an irish ale, beautiful nice copper body, average carbonation, thin and white head. The taste
is well balanced during all the sips. The taste is a bit metalic, malty, bready, dry one, some hop but it is not so fruity that they say on the picture, at the final sip you can smell some touch of caramel.

Bitter de 4,3 % abv et 30 ebu, en format 35,5 cl, avec dit le brasseur du "fruity hop" et du "rich malt
middle" .. N’en jetez plus, de toute façon, c’est la dégustation qui tranche...
Malt d’orge et de froment. Mon exemplaire était à 5 mois avant sa date.
Couleur ambré moyen, à la clarté nette, pure.
Bulles fines, partout, très vives.
Mousse beige, épaisse, avec des cratères en haut, stable à 7 mm.
Arômes d’un malt grillé, houblon, pointe de tilleul.
1ère bouche souple à la belle entame malt/houblon.
Arrière-bouche un peu légère, avec une pointe d’épice.
2ème agréable, mais l’ensemble est moins joli.
Arrière-bouche où l’épice dérange un peu.
3ème à l’ensemble qui descend sur une amber classique.
Arrière-bouche sans vrai caractère.
La longueur loin de redresser, continue la descente (comme les honkers eux-mêmes ..).
Jambes à flocons moyens, courtes.
Levure basique.
Alcool très peu convaincant, il laisse les saveurs se planter.
Finale risible.
CONCLUSION : le chauffard s’est planté, c’est normal … Mais Goose island, en faisant dans le 
populaire, s’est planté aussi … Et on peut même dire que c’est un "riche plantage middle" … (5/3/3/2/5)
Légère, son meilleur atout. Manque de force et de caractère, mais reste assez équilibrée et agréable.
Robe ambrée limipide, fine mousse blanche. Nez malté et caramel. Attaque maltée caramel, fin de bouche légèrement amère sur des houblons herbeux, faible longueur. Corps aqueux, alcool léger.

Drunk at Molloys Watford. From the bottle. Not great aftertaste actually not as good as I remember. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This was once a good beer. Now that ABI mass produces it it’s awful. It’s all you find at the airports and I refuse drink that swill. Awful.

Imported by Cerveceria Chile. Found on Henua Market, Easter Island. Pours a clear copper color with a medium white head that diminishes quickly. Aroma is malty, with cereally and bready notes, hints of cardboard and some shiny fruity hints. I’m getting a nose of mostly red apple, orange, papaya, loads of cereals and grains and a bit of caramel. Yes, I get the English Bitter nuances. Taste is moderately bitter, fresh and crisp with fruity flavors providing nice balance. Moderate sweetness. Not packed with flavors, this is clearly a light-hearted ale meant to be a sessionable drink. I could have lots of these, but so could I have lots of Session IPA’s or hoppy Pilsners. And Honkers Ale would not end up being favored in a comparison. Not bad but forgettable.
Belated check in. Simple beer. No complexity and nothing remarkable. Might be good on a hot day. But so is ice water. Didn't finish.

Not a bad beer by any means. Its pretty good. But its probably my least favorite Goose Island beer, and Goose Island is my favorite brewery by far. It just really lacks that uniqueneas and multiple layers of flavora and palate that goose island always has.

Bottle @ Fiddlers. Unbelieveable I haven’t tried this beer before. Pours a clear darker golden beer wtih a nice, fluffy white head on top. Aroma is malty and grassy, bit of everthing in there, nice subtle mix of medium hoppyness and some malty softness. Flavor is basically the same, fairly sweet and easy going, medium high in carbonation and has great drinkability. Session beer for sure, interesting not so much.

355 ml bottle. Got it at work, though widely available in Santiago. Good smell, yeasty, creamy. Amber color with dense foam. Hoppy taste with creamyness and good ending, a little bit to soft for me, but still decent.

Bottle, 355ml. Copper colour with a small white head that quickly diminishes. Aroma has plenty of malt, clove and sweetness. Flavour has biscuit, a little sourness, some spicy hop. Disappointing thin body and a bitter but watery finish Carbonation a little too high. Better than average but nothing special.
Great example of an American amber. They say ’English bitter’ but its a malty-amber hit that segues into a crisp, hoppy finish that I think defines it.
Couleur ambrée, légère mousse. Nez caramel, caramel blond, houblonné type anglais. Gout caramélisé, houblonné herbeux avec bonne amertume en fin de bouche . Corps leger.

Appearance: bright amber with great head
Aroma: fresh grass, hops, light citrus
Mouthfeel: medium mouthfeel and carbonation
Taste: clean upfront, then malt, caramel, toffee. Medium clean bitterness on aftertaste
Overall: really enjoyed this beer

Clear amberish copper with a thick rocky ivory head. Bright English malty nose that’s a touch bready with quiet grassy slightly pear-like hop tones. Crisp English bready malt flavors dominate the palate with a crisp semidry body and super gentle toffee with a very light citrus floral hop grassiness. Very quiet hops but not so malty that it goes into the dark or doppel category. Just a brisk malty English Ale.

Bread and malt smells with some sour apple.Pours a cloudy orange with an anemic white qyuickly dissipating head. Plenty of lacing. Oily bitter flavors of leather and a little caramel malty notes. Good imitation of the style.

Aroma: malty, fruity, floral, 
Appearance: brown, little hazy, minimal head, white foam, 
Taste: lightly bitter, light sweetness, hops, 
Palate: light body, thin feel, soft carbonation, bitter finish

Aroma is bitter, tropical fruit, caramel, more fruity than caramel, earthy hops. Appearance is amber, light tan head, clear. Taste is bitter, fruity, caramel malt, grain, cereal, earthy hops, good. Mouthfeel is light body, light crisp carbonation, bitter fruity earthy hop aftertaste. Overall, this is a pretty solid bitter.
Was stationed in England in the USAF. Drank many a bitter. Honkers brings me back there., I love your beer. This is my new everyday.

Bottle 12 fl.oz / Le Grain d’Orge - Crissioer (CH). Amber with an average cream head and aromas of hop, caramel, slight fruity white and lemon. The taste is dry, malt, caramel, hop, slight fruity, bitter grassy-earthy, notes of lemon, zest and biscuit. Well and truly bitter.

Pours deep copper. Small head. Not much to nose bar light caramel and hops. Tastes like a session English ale but then finishes dry and hoppy unlike an English ale. Quite pleasant, but is that enough these days 🤔.

A 12 fl oz bottle, bottled on 18th November 2016 and best before 18th November 2017. Poured into a Mikkeller pint glass. It was a nice clear copper colour with a one finger off white head that slowly dissipates to a nice thin creamy layer while leaving curtain like lacing. Aromas were a bit light, but what I do get was grassy, nutty, sweet malt and hints of toffee. Tastes of toasty biscuit malt, caramel, nuttiness with hints of orange citrus. Light bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall not my favourite style, but this is easy to drink.
Une belle bière de soif à la robe ambrée, à la mousse crémeuse, au nez qui exprime de belles notes houblonnées sur un fond malté et une bouche à la fois ronde et fraîche. Agréable à l’apéro.

Nice beer. Caramel aroma - bit of sweetness to it. Red clear appearance. Good balance to the taste - mild bitterness,medium sweetness. Pleasant English style bitter - while nothing outrageous, this is a dinkable, pleasant beer.

Cerveja marrom, com nuances âmbar, pouca espuma, desaparecendo rapidamente. Aroma muito suave de malte, sem graça, assim como o sabor, 
quase não dá pra se notar nada, exceto um amargor leve no final. Totalmente desinteressante.

Bottle from GI Japan web store. Pours a nice clear amber-copper with beige lacing. Caramel malt and cardboard aroma, grassy earthiness, mild fruitiness. After a few minutes the flavour shows itself nicely, light raspberry notes with caramel, decent chewy earthy malt, fruit hop bitterness. A bit over-carbonated for my liking, firm bitterness on the tongue and lingering sweetness. Decent.

Najlepsze z trzech testowanych przeze mnie piw z Goose Island, chociaż i tak nie wybija się ponad przeciętność. 
Aromat cytrusowy, lekki, czuć też słodowość.
Piana średnioziarnista, dość szybko opada.
Wygląd: lekko zmętnione, barwa ciemnozłocista
Smak: Lekka cytryna, słodowość, goryczka minimalna.
33cl bottle. Clear copper with a thin off-white head. Biscuit, toffee, citrus and caramel. Nice.
Flasa v Saltney. Jantarova farba, slaba pena. Vona sladova, jemne karamel, susienky. Chut opat sladova, karamelova, susienky, trosku ovocia.

Bottle from Hopt. Aroma is biscuity malt, soft fruity hops, fruits, berries, jam, touch of caramel. Flavour is moderate sweet and moderate to medium bitter. Body is almost medium. Not bad, nicely fruity, more aromatic than the average English Bitter.
Barwa bursztynowa prawie czerwona. Piana niska szybko opadajaca. Aromat fajny miodowo owocowy tropikalny. W smaku chmielowo mocno fajnie . Fajne piwo polecam .
Bottle at home. Pours an amber colour. On the sweet side. Subtly malty. Light bodied.

Pours hazy amber/copper with a huge frothy white head. The aroma contains malts, hops, ripe fruits, toffee and caramel. It tastes light sweet and light bitter. Crispy finish, a tad metallic, watery texture, medium body. Bland but drinkable.

Amber with nicewhite head.
Aroma is fruity and caramel. A bit watery and boring.

Bottle. Malty (caramel, toffee). Fruity (citrus, oranges, peel). Hoppy (floral & spicy hops). Great Malt/Hop balance. Sweet with citrus hoppy bitter edge. Lingering malty fruity finish. Easy drinking beer. (2008)

Bottle as gift. Pours clear ruby-copper with a light beige head. Nose of toffee then buttery brown bread, mild warming malts then lemonade. Taste is sweet syrupy malt with a mildly bitter citrus peel hop and more buttery bread on the finish. A soft body with moderate carbonation with an oily finish. Overall the sweet buttery malts and nice balancing citrus hop work in harmony making it smooth and refreshing.

Bottle. Unpleasant-ish smell on first pour. Deep amber colour. Fairly shallow flavour. I first tasted this years ago and couldn't remember what it was like. Five minutes after drinking this bottle, amnesia returns. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Morrisons, Birtley and B&M, Team Valley, Gateshead. Bright amber coloured with a thin white head.  It has a woody, gentle pine and malty flavour followed by a slight almond, fruity and earthy finish. Not bad.

Caramel, bread and freshly mowed grass, none of them particularly strong, are released in the attractive pour over a copper-penny ale. Good balance of bitter and sweet with just a little more sweetness than lingers into the finish. Could easily drink a few of these in a sitting.

I’m not going to remember this beer after I’m done drinking it, so it’s hard to really judge it beyond "It’s not terrible." And it isn’t—it’s got a njfe smoothness to it that makes it easy to drink, but that’s kind of all it has.
Reminds me of a bad version of Sam Adams Boston Lager. Red amber color. Not much head. Malty flavor with a slight bitter finish. Underwhelming.
Rory’s Birthday bottles. Pitched as an English bitter this was more a malty Scottish eighty shilling. Little bitterness but pleasantly malty with nothing on the nose.

On tap.
Aroma of Apple, herbs, fruity hops.
Poured orange blond with an off white head.
Malty taste, caramel, turns into a more bitter taste.
Dry bitter finish. 
I liked this. Easy drinking.

Pours copper with a fluffy off white head. Aroma of toffee and malt. Taste is slightly sweet with notes of grains, light malt, and earthy hops. There is a tangy vinegar off-flavour and metallic note that I don’t remember when I had this about a year ago. It might be just a bad can but it’s so off putting I don’t think I will be trying this again.

Acheter chez Vanuxeem à Ploegstreet.
Bouteille de 35,5cl.
Couleur ambrée reflet brown clair et assez translucide.
Petit col de mousse assez leger.
Au nez : c’est maltée et un peu épicé et note très discrète de sucre , une pointe de houblon.
En bouche : c’est un peu sans goût . Présence d’eau .
légerement maltée et houblonée plutôt floral .
un impression en bouche étrange , un peu cremeuse je trouve , pas assez rond .
pas trop mal faite mais manque plus de panache !

Pours light Amber, dark golden. Head disappears very quickly. Low carbonation. Fruity caramel toffee smell. Medium malt smell. Strong caramel toffee taste at first. Goes over into a lingering bitterness. Overall: caramel toffee is too overpowering, but an alright bitter, nothing amazing.

Pours clear, beautiful amber, with a small white head. Aroma is caramel and malts. Sweet malts, caramel in its taste, with good floral and bitter hops to balance. Simple as it is, a very enjoyable bitter!
B. Pours a clear amber color with white head. Malty with a slightly strange after taste
light malt aroma. amber and clear in color with nice head. taste is nicely balanced. starts malty and finishes with nice earthy/pine hop flavors.
Versão americana da cerveja. Amargor marcante mas um pouco aguada. Esperava mais.
Bouteille en grande surface. Belle couleur orange limpide. Nez de fruits agrumes, houblon. Bouche : fraîche, genre "pils" avec des goûts de fruits et d’épices. Légère aigreur en plus de l’amertume !

355 ml bottle bought at YATA in MOKO, Mong Kok.



Clear amber orange colour; One-quarter finger head and residual soapy white foam which fades in 30 seconds; Fair sticky lacing with barely notable slight carbonation; Fragrant aroma of Amber malt, with strong caramel, sticky toffee, cherry / red fruits, floral, sugar, resin, bread, lemon and light grass; 
Close to light sweet taste of fair malt, with strong wheat, light tartness, caramel, floral, molasses notes, biscuits, light lemon, fair to light grassy bitter hops; Mid to light body. Slick and slightly oozy palate; Mouth Feel is fair Ale maltyness in a slick background. Heavily wheat-thinned but tartness is light. Some caramel, no toffee nor red fruits, light floral and minimal sweetness. Biscuity with fair lemon to round. Neat... Hoppiness is floral, resin, lemon and light grass in nose. Floral, light lemon and light grass in taste; Bitterness is pretty light strong for an abrupt, fairly low astringent caramel wheaty finish; Fairly dry after taste. Easy and light bitter to mouth.



Comments: This is quite a fairly well-made Bitter, and I really like its rich caramel and toffee aroma, but the body has too much wheat, taste- and hop-wise are too timid. If this is a no-name Bitter I will be content, but this is Goose Island so I expected more. Too light for me.

Bottle of 35,5 cl, in a Tumbler glass; from the fridge. 

Usual but nice "pub" ale, with a malty taste that reminds of beer as the Kilkenny. Beautiful deep orange colour and a little white fuzzy head.

The taste is mostly malty, with little notes of hops.

F: big, off-white, good retention.
C: amber to coppery, clear.
A: rich malty, grassy, floral, hint of orange, butterscotch, nutty, caramel.
T: malty, banana, iron, caramel, floral hops, nutty, bready, mineral, good bittrenes in the palate, medium body, medium carbonation, good balanced between hops and rich malty, 0,355l bottle from Carrefour market @ Etterbeek, Brussels.

Pours slightly burnt orange with frothy white head that disappears to a lace. Aroma is quite phenolic, very much like a belgian. Taste is very malty, strong toffee, bready, mild but present English fruity earthy hops and yeast. Although not a ?clean? beer the favours are very distinct and fresh, not muddled. I would have mistaken this for a 5-6% beer, not a 4.3% abv beer, which is commendable. Like a cross between an english IPA and a belgian double flavour wise
pours clear copper gold with a medium beige head. light floral aroma. Nicely balanced. Definite malt presence with some mild hop bitter. Feels bigger than 4.3%. An enjoyable brew.

Deep golden colored, medium- off white frothy head. Aroma is malty, some biscuit, fruity and grassy hops. Taste is medium- sweet pale malt, light caramel, some biscuit, light to medium bitterness, medium- citrus lemony-orange and grassy hops, dry finish. Light+ bodied, soft carbonation, watery.

From a bottle. Pours copper with a thick, frothy off-white head. Smells like floral, citrus hops, caramel, and toasted malt. Tastes like bitter hops and malty with light sweetness. Light/medium body and carbonation.
Don’t bother. Unless you just awoke from a coma in 1980, this is nothing new and in no way interesting. It tastes like wonder bread and water. Looks better than a bud light, not much better tasting.

Lesser known than Goose Island IPA or the Urban series, this one too is made under AB InBev’s control for a large and worldwide audience, and apparently intended as an English bitter. Medium thick, off-white, dense head leaving a creamy rim around the glass and patches of thin foam in the middle; cristal clear orange amber colour with coppery hue, warm and adorned by multiple strings of lively sparkling. Aroma does indeed remind me of a typical English bitter, with notes of fresh - even burnt - toast, moist white pepper, jute, roasted pine nuts, caramel, dried bitter garden weeds, orange peel, parsley (iron), old cookies, vague hints of cigarette tobacco (unsmoked), hard butterscotch candy, dried grass and some cooked green beans, likely representing pasteurization, which is indeed faintly noticeable and becomes a bit more pronounced as it warms up. Restrained but crisp and clean fruitiness in the onset, hints of dried banana, apricot and unripe plum, sourish and sweetish but both subdued, spritzy and minerally carbonation, smooth and slick, medium body. Malty middle as expected, some faint caramelly sweetness but mostly a nutty and eventually toasted, softly bittering character, matching with gentle and ’noble’ hop bitterness in the finish, a tad resinous and tonic water-like and in that sense adequately drying and bittering, floral and grassy, going down alongside the toasted malt bitterness but remaining inside the throat for a longer time than the latter. The term ’pale ale’ as such (or in fact EPA - English pale ale) has largely become obsolete these days, but this one qualifies, with a notably nutty and deeply European hop bitter character; originally pale ale was not much more than a bottled bitter anyway. The distinction is vague and a bit shrouded in history, but since the English themselves hardly ever use the term anymore and refer to bottled bitters just as ’bitter’ in some or other form, this easily qualifies as one. Hadn’t I known better, I’d situate this in England rather than in the U.S.; clean, crisp, to the point and quenching, this is a fine, albeit somewhat understated and notably ’clean’ example of its style.

4.3%ABV. ESB.

Poured out deep amber, light brown. 16ºSRM.

Nose has some clean beery aromas. Inviting.

Mouthfeel is watery and beery with good carbonation. Palate has some pleasant malted candy, toffee and fresh cream flavors. Nice roasted nutty flavor. Nicely balanced with some solid bitter hops.

Clean finish.

Goes on Favorites List!
Pours clean amber with small white head. Aroma of malt. Taste of light bitter. Bitter finish. Decent but nothing special.

341ml bottle. Pours a hazy copper with lots of sediment floating around and a medium, short lived, off-white head that laces. Sweet aroma of caramel malt, wheat, bread, peach and orange. Sweet flavour of caramel malt, biscuit, wheat, orange, peach and grass with a dry, bitter, hoppy finish. Light to medium body with an oily texture and average carbonation. Ok.

Tap pour at Cityworks. Kind of a tulip glass which seems odd given this beer is as run of the mill as it gets. Copper in color with hard to find white head. Aroma is malty and slightly caramel but nothing amazing. Slight roasted malt. Taste is bready and malty with an assertive bitterness. Definite nuttiness. Kind of like what you taste when you wrap up a cup of tea. Some mild grassy notes with a little floral quality. This is more interesting than something like a traditional domestic but that’s about all it can top.

Bottle - Pours a medium amber, white head, fades quick, but leaves lacing. Aroma of sweet caramel malt, figs, other dark fruit. Tastes of sweet malts, fermented breads, caramel, toffee, dry hops. Feels like an amber lager. Decent Bitter.

4.3% light amber colour with a good head, slight toffee aroma, fruity caramel malt taste, very nice.
A new label and name for an old beer and the new label is really poor compered to the old one.

Style et résumé: Bitter. 


Comment: Canette de 473ml. 


Description: Une belle robe cuivrée. Un nez simple de caramel, de houblon anglais, d’herbe. Une bouche agréable, simple avec une touche de caramel. Bien facile à boire. 

 
Note:  7/10

Bouteille achetée Au Grain D’Orge- De couleur ambrée limpide avec une mousse blanc cassé onctueuse qui colle bien au verre - Au nez des arômes malté, caramel, biscuits, une pointe de torréfaction, des houblons floraux qui rajoute une note britannique, un nez typique des bitter ou amber ale anglaise - En bouche on reste sur un equilibre malt/houblon maîtrisé, les houblons prennent légèrement le pas sur le malt, toujour caramel biscuits, des aromes métalliques pas terrible, les houblons sont un peu agrumeux en bouche ce qu’on n’avait pas au nez et quivest un peu dérangeant a mon gout j’airais préféré floral - Corp léger, amertume moyenne, carbonation correcte, finne et aqueuse, fibal malté et amère moyennement longue - j’ai apprécié le nez mais beaucoup moin la bouche
On tasting at High Point. Golden color, malty and somewhat hoppy. Quite drinkable stuff, but nothing more.
Een heel fruitige geur. Een amber kleur. De smaak valt wat tegen, de geur is beter dan de smaak.
Bottle. Fruity aroma. Malty taste with grassy hop notes. Light bodied. Harsh bitter ending.
this was bought for me at a pub by my buddy, happy to see something different on tap that the typical lagers but this wasnt to my liking.
On tap @ Clybourn: Amber color. Floral aroma. Rich fresh bread and biscuit maltiness, low carbonation. I thought this was a nice, flavorful interpretation.

Kolor bursztynowy, miedziany, klarowny. Piana w kolorze ecru, niezbyt wysoka i momentalnie si? redukuje, tworzy zaledwie cienki film.
Aromat: s?odowo, jest s?odko, karmel, br?zowy cukier
w smaku jest w?a?ciwie podobnie, karmel br?zowy cukier, lekka przypalona nuta, i ...
... grapefruitowa, sucha goryczka. ?rednio d?uga idealnie balansuj?ca s?odycz, to du?y plus. Wysycenie ?rednie w kierunku do niskiego.

Hazy amber color with floating detritus and a low amount of activity. Weak white half a finger head that lasts no more than 5 minutes, with moderate amount of legs.

Aromas of caramel, butterscotch, and bread. Flavors of sweet grains, lemon, caramel, ginger, herbal and floral spices. Bready, roasted and grassy feel. Pleasant sweetness with a nice sharp feel.

Smooth medium to full body with a perfect amount of zesty carbonation. Light to medium strength finish of short length, ending with a sweet smoky caramel feel and faint grassy noble spices.

Overall good quality craft. Tasty flavors that are well balanced. Good freshness and nicely bodied.

12oz bottle. Pours Amber with medium head. Not much of a nose. Hoppy, sweet to mild bitter. Not a bad drink, but nothing remarkable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours clear amber with high beige head. Aroma is hops, bread, malts. Taste is light, bitter and a bit sweet with notes of bread, grass and flowers.
Coloração acobreada forte, corpo médio para o estilo, carbonatação forte, amargor condizente com as Bitter. Muito boa.

Medium amber pillow head. Aromas grass, light caramel, light zesty hops. Flavors medium grass, light zest, grainy. Lightly sweet, dry and bitter. A beer for those just getting into the ale’s from years of lager drinking.

Clean orange brown body, large stable head. Bready malts with American pine hops, nice. Taste is simpler, but still nice. The clean fermentation makes it very drinkable. Nice brew. (33 cl bottle from Prik & Tik Leuven)
Clear amber body with a medium light orange head. Aroma is malt, caramel, fruit. Taste is sweet and medium bitter. Soft carbonation, watery texture.
O Sabor é sensacional! Amargor e doçura bem equilibrados! Vale a pena provar! Vai bem no frio ou no calor!
355ml bottle. Aroma is all malts. Little red fruit but it’s mostly just malts and a bitter finish. Not particularly interesting or impressive.

De Cerveceria Goose Island(E.U.A) ahora propiedad de la macro cervecera AB in Bev(BEL), esta "Honkers Ale" una Strong Bitter de 4.3% ABV, buen contenido alcohólico para este estilo que tiene bastante tradición en Inglaterra, su producción se remonta a las cervezas de fermentación Ale en Brewpubs derivadas de las English Pale Ale pero servidas directo de barril con un balance bastante similar, las Strong Bitter son la versión Premium de las Ordinary y las Best Bitter, en las cuales supuestamente se utilazaban los elementos mas finos y una posible mayor graduación alcohólica, en Estados Unidos estas son tambien muy conocidas como "ESB" por la etiqueta de la emblemática cervecera inglesa Fuller’s.
Esta Bitter posee una corona de espuma mediana de perlas cristalinas, retención media y una carbonatación baja, en el color se aprecia un tono ambarino claro con destellos color dorado, cerveza filtrada ya que ofrece una transparencia no muy común para una cerveza fermentada con levadura Ale, de cuerpo bastante ligero.
Ya las notas en nariz que tiende a desarrollar son florales por lúpulos europeos sin embargo no se sobreponen a las de las maltas que están ahí como soporte principal dando aromas a bizcocho, algo de caramelo y carácter tostado merodeando los demás olores igual que una muy volátil frutosidad.
Tiene en boca un amargor consistente y seco, de aspecto herbal con mínima resinosidad pero tambien es notable el sabor de la malta a bizcocho y costra de pan que dan la impresión de ligera tostadez, dulzor bajo con algo de caramelo, algo débil y mucho mas sesionable en sabor para una Strong Bitter pero cumple siendo bastante agradable y dándonos una muestra de los tradicionales estilos ingleses, una cerveza que podría servir para los recién iniciados en la prueba de cervezas con mas carácter que las comunes Adjunt Lager de la miscelánea.

Keg at the Drury Hotel - St. Louis. Pours clear gold with a creamy topping. The nose has bready malts, mild ripening citrus. Light-medium sweet flavour with some leafy hops, mild piney bitterness, lightly toasted bread. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Sweet and bready on the finish, with faint metallic bite, some grain, hints of honey, caramel. So so overall.

341 ml bottle from Co-Op Liquor Store, served in my Molson Light pilsner glass. Pours a light cola shade, with plenty of even, slow fine carbonation from all over the glass’ bottom, and a short collar of off-white head that holds firm and leaves fine lace rings. In other words, it looks fantastic. Nose is clean, moderately sweet malt with caramel, touched with spice and nuts, and redolent with fresh tree fruit and red berries; on the tongue, it’s almost all lightly sweet, smooth, doughy malts with a speck of earthiness. Thin-bodied, slightly prickly carbonation, and with a brief, clean, dry finish. Goose Island truly does justice to the ESB profile with Honkers. Altogether delicious and eminently drinkable.

Plain ol’ “Bitter” might be the epitome of British-style brews. Despite the name, beers of the style tend to be rather sweet and only mildly bitter. Any American brewery that makes one that’s decent is worthy of commendation; such is the case with Goose Island Honkers Ale. This is one of their original brews and I can see why it’s maintained appeal all these years. It’s a very drinker-friendly beer in all aspects (but not an amazing one).



I poured a 12oz bottle into a tumbler glass. It was bottled on 7/27/15 and cost $1.66 ($0.14 per ounce).



Appearance: A pretty shade of copper/magenta with a clear body and carbonation visible. Pours to an average-sized, off-white, foamy head which retains and laces well.



Smell: Lightly fruity, though I detect some signs of oxidation. Slightly floral; though mild overall.



Taste: There seems to be a lot going on in this beer… and yet, not much at all. I do taste a genuine malt flavor – quite grainy and slightly biscuity. This creates for sweetness, but it’s mild. Lurking in the background is a dry bitterness with just a hint of resin. Faint caramel or treacle flavor on the backend which creates for additional sweetness, and then it finishes almost completely clean. All these characteristics are enjoyable to be sure. Perhaps I shouldn’t penalize it for being mild since that’s the point of the style. Still, a little more pizzazz would be nice.



Drinkability: At 4.3% ABV, Goose Island Honkers Ale is a sessionable beer to be sure. The mouthfeel is crisp with a consistent moistness to it as well. Though there is noticeable hop presence, there’s no lingering bitterness. I would consider it refreshing while in the mouth. I could see this working well in the summer, especially from a can, though it’s got the palette to work as a year-round brew, too.



RATING: 6/10

Bottle, 355mL. Pours deep amber, almost like apple juice, with a quickly disappearing beige head. Mouthfeel is moderately fluffy. Fruity finish. It’s not mindblowing, but it’s definitely well executed. The "fruity aroma - rich malt middle" deScription on the can is accurate. Easy drinking. I certainly wouldn’t mind buying again considering low price and wide availability.

Shampoo/perfumy (honey/vanilla type esters). Chewy body, surprising for lack of caramel type flavors there are present. Moderately high bitterness with a tinge on the side of the palate. Extremely drinkable. Spot on for an AM interpretation of an English Best Bitter.

Bière orangée-cuivrée, très légèrement voilée, effervescence soutenue, belle et uniforme, et surmontée d’un col légèrement brunâtre pas tellement large, mais très dense et crémeux, et qui semble éternel. Arôme de pain légèrement grillé, pâtisserie, sucre d’orge, léger miel, léger caramel. Aussi, effluves de houblon un peu fruité (pamplemousse surtout..), un peu herbacé, mais qui semble principalement poivré. Nez plutôt ordinaire, complexité et intensité moyennes. En bouche, pétillement moyen-faible sur la langue, onctuosité moyenne au palais. Au goût, malt qui semble plus céréalier qu’au nez, grain, pain légèrement grillé, léger sucre d’orge, suivi d’un houblon principalement herbacé (gazon, feuille verte, herbes aromatiques…) et poivré, pointe de pamplemousse. Finale à l’amertume légère mais tout de même bien sentie, équilibre malt/houblon intéressant, mais complexité et intensité en bouche qui restent plutôt faibles, impressions aqueuses par moment. Bière correcte, sans plus…

Bottle. Light bronze-amber with a small white head that leaves some nice lacing. Aroma of toffee, bruised apple, twiggy hops, and a hint of orange peel. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Simple but pleasant flavour that starts with light caramel and toasted malt, and finishes with balancing hops with notes of citrus and cut flowers, and a slight medicinal tang. Bitterness seems a bit higher than the advertised 30 IBU as it warms. Not too bad.

Creamy and soft mouthfeel. Delicate carbonation. Beer has an amber color with a medium, thick and creamy head. Aroma has typical bread skin and caramel background. Plus some toffee creaminess, bit of alcohol, flowers and zest. Flavor is not exciting but hey it’s a bitter and this one is on the better side with a juicy malt creamy malt base and some aromatic hops.
On tap at Buffalo Wild Wings. Pours amber with minimal off white head. Aroma of malts and fruit. Taste, well balanced sweet and bitterness. I enjoyed this beer.
Bit of a yeasty malty aroma. Sweet caramelish malt flavor. Clear copper color with white heaf. Light bodied. No likey.

Attractive Amber body lasting foamy white head and nice lacing. Sweet malty aroma maybe even a touch of cinnamon and spice in there. Taste is malty with a touch of spice and faint bit of medicinal hops. A bit of a watery finish. Not bad.

Bottle, 355ml. A clear amber beer with a small white head and a lot of gas. Aroma is not very strong, but there is some malt, caramel and yeast. Faint taste with some bitterness at the end. Light bodied with some carbonation and faint astringency. Aftertaste is very mild. Very easy to drink but only because it is very watery. Not much to say about this beer, except cute goose on the label. Wawk wawk

33cl bottle - Poured orange/amber with an off white head. Aroma - fruit/grass from hops.. Taste - medium bitterness,bread/cereal. Good approximation of an English bitter.

Pours a clean amber with a small, slight off white head; light lacing. Aroma is of fruity hops. Semi medium bitterness. Light to medium body, crisp on the tongue, slightly dry and bitter finish. Overall, a pleasant ale, nothing groundbreaking but an all around solid choice.

(355 ml) In jug pint . an american take on the quintessential uk style bitter ... bitters are always more flavoursome and interesting warm and from the cask . orange shade of liquid with just a subtle creamy white head.malty nose -bready , a little citrus hops .subtle strawberry . dranks with a rich bready malt texture and dry hoppy grapefruit mix. . quit legit to an esb such as london pride but as mentioned -this style is better cask.

341ml Bottle from Halles St-Jean. Aroma: caramel, citrus, herbacy. App: cloudy almost clear amber with medium off white frothy head. Taste and palate: medium body, light texture,medium carbonation, watery, tiny disappointing bitter and dry finish. Overall: not impressed. Lacking in bitterness, watery, body too thin. Could be a good pairing beer but alone, it?s quite boring.
On tap. Pours a copper colour with a small white head. Aroma is floral, a bit citrusy. Taste is fruits, herbal, hops.

Bière cuivrée, limpide, peu mousseuse. Nez légèrement floral sur un lit discret de caramel. En bouche, des houblons mi-fruités mi-herbacés s’échangent les politesses sur le plancher de danse. Un peu de biscuit en périphérie. Rien ne dépasse de la trame. Les temps sont comptés et la cadence ne sombre pas dans la démesure. C’est pas mal ce à quoi je m’attends d’une Bitter. C’est un peu mince, sans être aqueux. Je l’ai essayée en fût et en bouteille et le produit est très similaire dans les deux cas (c’est positif).

Out of a can. Aroma is herbal, piney, with a little citrus. Nice rich amber hue with lacing as I drink. Caramel sweetness and typical English hops flavor that is faint with some pine and minimal citrus. Soft dry bitterness on the palate.

Light bronze with a dense, medium head, some lacing and a honey, peach nose. Malty intro with a mildly-carbonated, soft palate reminiscent of an English Ale. Finishes with honey, barely ripe peaches, and a mild bitterness.

* Bottle. Pours gold, clear, with a tan head. 
* Aroma fruity hops & bready, caramel malts. 
* Palate is medium body, medium carbonation, very fine bubbles. 
* Taste is caramel, nut, bread & slight spice. 
* Finish is malty, bittersweet, moist. 
* Overall refreshing, caramel, nut, bread.
Deep amber color with a medium white lacing head. Malty aroma, not a lot of hops. Smooth, not bad.

Listed everywhere i see it as an apa, but this classification of bitter is more appropriate, maybe even english pale ale. Clear gold pour, with a small white head. Aroma is slightly pungent, subtle uk hops, pale malts, decent cereals, mouthfeel and carb are spot on, the finish is lightly bitter with some floral uk hops, and a solid malt bill. Nothing spectacular, but well executed and a good session ale.

Bottle from Whole Foods in Richmond upon Thames, pours amber-brown with a thin head and a fruity, lightly earthy hop nose. Lightly nutty with toffeeish malt and an earthy bitterness, with a bit less gas this would be a quite decent "premium bottled ale".
On tap at Heart & Crown - Byward Market. Clear copper with a frothy off-white head. Flavors are toasted cereals, citrus and caramel with fruity notes. Light body, soft carbonation, slick texture.

Aroma is lacklustre, not much to it really. Looks fantastic a very deep dark honey colour. Taste is what you would expect from a bitter, it’s bitter but very drinkable. On the palate it’s interesting, rather fizzy on the tongue but almost sticky on the way down. Overall: ok, nothing spectacular.

Draft at a local Pizza place. Aroma of fruit with light caramel and hops. Light amber color with a slight white head. Hoppy flavor with with spice and caramel to give it backbone. Easily drinkable with a hoppy finish.

I liked this more than most other bitters. It’s not as boring thanks to the spice kick.
Amber pour, large head. Aroma is bready, caramel, earthy hops. Caramel and bread up front, bitter hopping in the background, malty finish. Medium body. Easy drinking.
Bottle from asda a copper brown beer aroma is carmel and malt nutty carmel flavour light bitter finish

Appearance: Dark copper body with a fluffy white head. Good lacing. Great transparency.

Aroma: Spicy hop aroma that leaps from the glass.

Taste: I get a good deal of caramel and a bit of toast at the end. No bitterness that I can detect.

Palate: Again there is no real bitterness to cut back the sweet caramel flavor so it leaves a bit of sweetness on the mouth after drinking. Very watered down, but not bad...just not completely there.

Overall: It was a pretty good beer but it really didn’t stand out to me. I would gladly drink it again but it’s just not something I would rush out to buy. I recommend giving it a shot because it does have a good simple flavor profile. It’s like drinking iced tea. It’s better than water but it just feels like it’s missing something.
